metadata.title: CVE-2020-35342 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
GNU Binutils before 2.34 has an uninitialized-heap vulnerability infunction tic4x_print_cond (file opcodes/tic4x-dis.c) which could allowattackers to make an information leak.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-35342` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

binutils - 2.24-5ubuntu14.2+esm3
binutils-multiarch - 2.24-5ubuntu14.2+esm3
binutils-source - 2.24-5ubuntu14.2+esm3
binutils-static - 2.24-5ubuntu14.2+esm3
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: binutils package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.24-5ubuntu14.2+esm3').
